doc:
Corinne Malvern https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corinne_Malvern 0 Corinne Malvern (December 13, 1901 – November 9, 1956) was an American commercial artist, active as a fashion advertising artist and illustrator of children's books between the early 1930s and her death in 1956. She painted magazine covers and worked as Art Editor of Ladies Home Journal magazine. She is best known for her illustrations in the Little Golden Books series, including Heidi, Frosty the Snow Man (also known, incorrectly, as Frosty the Snowman), The Night Before Christmas, Doctor Dan the Bandage Man, and Nurse Nancy. She illustrated 32 books, 17 for Little Golden Books. She also wrote and illustrated at least one children's book (How Big, later republished as How Big Are You, Little Golden Books, 1949). Her last book, Five Pennies To Spend, was published in 1955. Corinne_Malvern ( December_13_,_1901 – November_9_,_1956 ) was an_American_commercial_artist , active as a_fashion_advertising_artist_and_illustrator of children 's_books between the_early_1930s and her_death in 1956 . She painted magazine_covers and worked as Art_Editor of Ladies_Home_Journal_magazine . She is_best_known for her_illustrations in the_Little_Golden_Books_series , including Heidi , Frosty the_Snow_Man (_also_known , incorrectly , as Frosty_the_Snowman_) , The_Night Before Christmas , Doctor_Dan the_Bandage_Man , and Nurse_Nancy . She illustrated 32_books , 17 for Little_Golden_Books . She also wrote and illustrated at_least_one_children 's_book ( How Big_,_later republished as How_Big Are You , Little_Golden_Books , 1949_) . Her_last_book , Five_Pennies To_Spend , was_published in 1955 .
